subscriptions_exceptionscheckbox-s1.message: If {1}, the filter list for non-intrusive ads will get special treatment and will be displayed as a checkbox in the user interface.

subscriptions_fallbackerrors-s1.message: Sets the required number of failed subscription download attempts before the fallback script (see {1}) will be consulted for the new address of the subscription. Note that Adblock Plus will always retry a download one day after a failed download attempt.

documentation_link-s2.message:
It will
redirect to the actual documentation location depending on the language used.

documentation_link-s1.message: Address on adblockplus.org to be opened for documentation links.

grouporder-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

checkedadblocksync-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

defaulttoolbaraction-s1.message: Defines the action that should be executed when the toolbar icon is clicked. Possible values are:

synchronizationinterval-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.0 and higher

subscriptions_exceptionsurlPrivacy.message: Location of the filter list used to allow only nonintrusive ads that are privacy-friendly.

notifications_ignoredcategories-descript.message: List of notification categories that the user opted out of.

showsubscriptions-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 1.0 and higher

localschemes-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

linktypes-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

linkcheck-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5.4 and higher

patternsfile-s1.message: Name of the file that should be used to store the list of filters. This can be either an absolute path, or it can be file's location relative to the user's profile.

frameobjects-s1.message: Value of the "Show tabs on Flash and Java" option

settings_key-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.0 and higher

recentReports-s1.message:
JSON-encoded data on recently submitted issue reports (address of the report,
website reported and time of submission)

savestats-s1.message: Value of the "Count filter hits" option

currentVersion-s1.message: Stores the last used Adblock Plus version, this will trigger actions that need to be done on upgrade or first install

enabled-s1.message: Value of the "Enable Adblock Plus" option

report_submiturl-s1.message: Address on adblockplus.org to submit issue reports to.

subscriptions_fallbackurl-s1.message: Address of the script that should be consulted if a subscription fails to download a certain number of times (see {1}). %s is replaced by the address of the subscription in question. The script should print something like "301 http://example.com/new_list.txt" if the new location of the subscription is known.

checkedadblockprefs-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

showintoolbar-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.0 and higher

patternsbackups-s1.message: Number of backups for patterns.ini that should be kept. If this is 0, backups will be disabled.

sidebar_key-s3.message: Starting with Adblock Plus 1.3.5 multiple comma-separated shortcuts can be specified, the first available keyboard shortcut from the list will be used.

warnregexp-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 1.0 and higher

removedIn2.9.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.9 and higher.

sendReport_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to send issue reports.

sendReport_key-s3.message: Note: This setting will only apply after the browser is restarted.

sendReport_key-s2.message: For description of possible values see {1}.

checkedadblockinstalled-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 1.0 and higher

suppress_first_run_page-s1.message: Suppresses the first run page Adblock Plus opens after the installation.

subscriptions_antiadblockurl-s1.message: Location of the subscription that hides anti adblock messages.

internal_preferencesTitle.message: Internal preferences (don't change unless you really know what you are doing)

composer_default-s1.message: Determines which suggestion should be selected in the filter composer by default:

detachsidebar-s1.message: Stores state of the list of blockable items — {1} means detached

defaultstatusbaraction-s1.message: Defines the action that should be executed when the status bar icon is clicked. For list of possible values see {1}.

filters_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to open Filter Preferences dialog. For description of possible values see {1}.

hideContributeButton-s1.message: This is set to {1} if the user chose to hide the Contribute button.

filters_key-s2.message: Note: This setting will only apply after the browser is restarted.

flash_scrolltoitem-s1.message: Defines whether "Flash item's borders" in the list of blockable items should try to scroll the item into view.

enable_key-s2.message: Note: This setting will only apply after the browser is restarted.

enable_key-s1.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to enable/disable Adblock Plus. For description of possible values see {1}.

lastRuleUpdate-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.3 and higher

whitelistschemes-s1.message: List of URL schemes that shouldn't be blocked (applied to both whole documents and to item locations)

patternsbackupinterval-s1.message: Minimal interval between two backups of patterns.ini (in hours)

subscriptions_autoupdate-s1.message:
Defines whether filters in filter subscriptions will be updated
automatically.

hideimagemanager-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.1 and higher

noncollapsabletypes-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

clearStatsOnHistoryPurge-s1.message: If true, clearing browsing history will also clear hit statistics for Adblock Plus filters. Note that the hit statistics often allow deducing which sites the user visited, when and how often.

whitelist-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.3 and higher

correctTyposAsked-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.3 and higher

blockableItemsSize-s1.message:
Remembered size of the Blockable Items list (width setting is only relevant when
displayed as a sidebar).

sidebar_key-s2.message: Defines the keyboard shortcut to be used to open blockable items. This preference can be empty or it can be of the form modifier1 modifier2 key. Recognized modifiers are: Shift, Accel (default accelerator key, e.g. Ctrl on Windows, Command on Mac OS X), Ctrl/Control, Alt, Meta. Key can be either a letter or a special key like F7 or RIGHT (see nsIDOMKeyEvent interface for a list of special keys).

subscriptions_exceptionsurl-s1.message: Location of the filter list used to allow non-intrusive ads.

sidebar_key-s4.message: Note: This setting will only apply after the browser is restarted.

blocktypes-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

correctTypos-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 2.3 and higher

blocklocalpages-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

showinstatusbar-s1.message: Value of the "Show in status bar" option

s2.message: The following table lists and explains all preferences that are used by Adblock Plus. These preferences can be viewed and changed via {1}.

protectchrome-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 1.0 and higher

previewimages-s1.message: Defines whether the tooltip in the list of blockable items should show the image that the item represents.

subscriptions_listurl-s1.message: Address to download the complete list of filter subscriptions from.

patterns-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 0.7.5 and higher

checktoolbar-s1.message: Unused in Adblock Plus 1.0 and higher

notifications_showui-description.message: Determines whether notification management UI should be displayed (only if the user opted out of notifications before).

fastcollapse-s2.message:
This might have the effect that
placeholders will show up for blocked images for example, unless hidden by other means.

fastcollapse-s3.message:
This functionality was available
as "Hide placeholders of blocked elements" before Adblock Plus 2.6.7.

fastcollapse-s1.message: If set to {1} blocked elements will no longer be hidden.

notificationurl-s1.message: Location of the file containing emergency notifications.
